extendedIngredients.name: celery ribs
extendedIngredients.original: 10 celery ribs, strings discarded if desired
extendedIngredients.originalName: celery ribs, strings discarded if desired

extendedIngredients.name: cider vinegar
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 teaspoon Sherry vinegar or cider vinegar

extendedIngredients.name: smoked ham
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 pound thinly sliced (1/8-inch-thick) cooked smoked ham

title: Deviled Ham on Celery
summary: Deviled Ham on Celery might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. One serving contains 22 calories, 1g of protein, and 2g of fat. This recipe serves 32. For 17 cents per serving, this recipe covers 1% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, whole 30, and ketogenic diet. If you have flat-leaf parsley, cider vinegar, mayonnaise, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 11%, this dish is not so amazing. Similar recipes are Spicy Stir-Fried Fennel, Celery, and Celery Root With Chinese Sausage, Potted Beef and Celery Root with Celery Gremolata, and Shaved Celery, Celery Root, and Radish Salad.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Trim a thin strip down length of rounded side of each celery rib to form a flat bottom, then rest celery on flat bottom. Cut away curved edges with a large knife to form flat-sided pieces of celery, discarding trimmings. Diagonally cut celery into 32 (1 1/4-inch) lengths.                                                                Pulse half of ham in a food processor until finely chopped, then mince remaining ham with a sharp large knife. Stir together finely chopped and minced ham with remaining ingredients and pepper to taste in a bowl, then mound 1 teaspoon of filling onto each piece of celery.                                                Cooks' notes:            路Celery can be cut 6 hours ahead and chilled, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap.路Deviled ham can be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered.

steps.step: Trim a thin strip down length of rounded side of each celery rib to form a flat bottom, then rest celery on flat bottom.
Cut away curved edges with a large knife to form flat-sided pieces of celery, discarding trimmings. Diagonally cut celery into 32 (1 1/4-inch) lengths.

Pulse half of ham in a food processor until finely chopped, then mince remaining ham with a sharp large knife. Stir together finely chopped and minced ham with remaining ingredients and pepper to taste in a bowl, then mound 1 teaspoon of filling onto each piece of celery.
路Celery can be cut 6 hours ahead and chilled, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap.路Deviled ham can be made 1 day ahead and chilled, covered.
